definition:
Let $a,b \in \mathbb{R}$ with $a<b$. A [*partition*]{} of an interval
$[a,b]$ is a set of nonempty subintervals
$\{ [a,x_1), [x_1,x_2), \dots , [x_{n-1}, b] \}$ for some positive
integer $n$. That is, $a<x_1<x_2<\dots<x_{n-1}<b$. Note that $n$ is the
number of subintervals in the partition.

Subinterval partitions are useful for defining Riemann integrals.

Note that subinterval partition is a specific case of a of a set since
the subintervals are defined so that they are pairwise disjoint.
